title: 'Bees starving' in dismal year for French honey
content: French beekeepers reported a catastrophic year for honey production due to adverse weather conditions. Mickael Isambert, a beekeeper in central France, faced an 80% drop in honey yield, having to feed his bees with sugar. Low temperatures and heavy rainfall limited bees' ability to collect pollen and nectar, leading to colony starvation and significant losses nationwide.
summary: French beekeepers reported a catastrophic year for honey production due to adverse weather conditions. Mickael Isambert, a beekeeper in central France, faced an 80% drop in honey yield, having to feed his bees with sugar. Low temperatures and heavy rainfall limited bees' ability to collect pollen and nectar, leading to colony starvation and significant losses nationwide.

title: Zelenskyy vows more 'retribution' for Russia as POWs exchanged
content: President Volodymyr Zelenskyy vowed intensified action against Russia on Ukrainian Independence Day. Kyiv and Moscow exchanged 230 prisoners, facilitated by the UAE. Zelensky signed a law banning the Russian-linked Ukrainian Orthodox Church. Meanwhile, tensions rise as Ukraine advances into Kursk and Russia targets Kostyantynivka in the ongoing conflict.
summary: President Volodymyr Zelenskyy vowed intensified action against Russia on Ukrainian Independence Day. Kyiv and Moscow exchanged 230 prisoners, facilitated by the UAE. Zelensky signed a law banning the Russian-linked Ukrainian Orthodox Church. Meanwhile, tensions rise as Ukraine advances into Kursk and Russia targets Kostyantynivka in the ongoing conflict.

title: Elon Musk weighs in on Telegram CEO Pavel Durov's arrest: 'It’s 2030 in Europe and ...'
content: Pavel Durov, founder and CEO of Telegram, was arrested at Le Bourget Airport near Paris for allegedly failing to moderate content on Telegram, allowing criminal activities. Elon Musk reacted by highlighting free speech issues on his social media platform, X. Durov, who resides in Dubai, is a dual citizen of France and the UAE.
summary: Pavel Durov, founder and CEO of Telegram, was arrested at Le Bourget Airport near Paris for allegedly failing to moderate content on Telegram, allowing criminal activities. Elon Musk reacted by highlighting free speech issues on his social media platform, X. Durov, who resides in Dubai, is a dual citizen of France and the UAE.

title: Who is Pavel Durov and what led to Telegram founder's arrest?
content: Pavel Durov, Telegram's founder, was detained at Le Bourget Airport, France. The arrest is linked to allegations regarding the app's inadequate content moderation leading to criminal activities. French authorities have remained silent on the matter, while Russia seeks to clarify the circumstances. Telegram hasn't issued a statement, keeping Durov's future and Telegram’s policies in the spotlight.
summary: Pavel Durov, Telegram's founder, was detained at Le Bourget Airport, France. The arrest is linked to allegations regarding the app's inadequate content moderation leading to criminal activities. French authorities have remained silent on the matter, while Russia seeks to clarify the circumstances. Telegram hasn't issued a statement, keeping Durov's future and Telegram’s policies in the spotlight.

title: Rare virus with 30% mortality detected in Hudson Valley; four US towns implement voluntary lockdown
content: A rare equine virus, Eastern Equine Encephalitis (EEE), detected in several Hudson Valley counties and surrounding states, posed a 30% human mortality rate. An elderly man in Massachusetts and a horse in New York have been infected. Massachusetts towns implemented a voluntary evening lockdown to curb mosquito-borne threats, urging residents to stay indoors after peak mosquito hours.
summary: A rare equine virus, Eastern Equine Encephalitis (EEE), detected in several Hudson Valley counties and surrounding states, posed a 30% human mortality rate. An elderly man in Massachusetts and a horse in New York have been infected. Massachusetts towns implemented a voluntary evening lockdown to curb mosquito-borne threats, urging residents to stay indoors after peak mosquito hours.

title: 'Brace for tough times ahead': UK PM Keir Starmer prepares nation for a difficult road to recovery
content: Prime Minister Keir Starmer, in an upcoming speech, will address the nation's deep-seated issues. He admitted the road to recovery would be long, emphasizing the broken state inherited from the previous government. Starmer pointed to recent anti-migrant riots as evidence, vowing transparency and tough decisions to rectify the systemic rot.
summary: Prime Minister Keir Starmer, in an upcoming speech, will address the nation's deep-seated issues. He admitted the road to recovery would be long, emphasizing the broken state inherited from the previous government. Starmer pointed to recent anti-migrant riots as evidence, vowing transparency and tough decisions to rectify the systemic rot.

title: Telegram CEO Pavel Durov arrested in France: Reports
content: Pavel Durov, Telegram’s CEO, was detained at Paris’s Bourget airport due to an arrest warrant tied to a police investigation on content moderation issues. He was apprehended while traveling from Azerbaijan. Durov, who holds a fortune of $15.5 billion, founded Telegram after leaving Russia in 2014 to resist government demands.
summary: Pavel Durov, Telegram’s CEO, was detained at Paris’s Bourget airport due to an arrest warrant tied to a police investigation on content moderation issues. He was apprehended while traveling from Azerbaijan. Durov, who holds a fortune of $15.5 billion, founded Telegram after leaving Russia in 2014 to resist government demands.

title: At 34, Donald Trump had dismissed the idea of becoming President. Now he is seeking second term in office
content: At 34, Donald Trump had dismissed the idea of becoming President, noting the harshness of political life. He emphasized the lack of capable leaders in politics, stating that executives often avoided political office. Ironically, Trump later became the 45th President and is now preparing for his second term against Kamala Harris.
summary: At 34, Donald Trump had dismissed the idea of becoming President, noting the harshness of political life. He emphasized the lack of capable leaders in politics, stating that executives often avoided political office. Ironically, Trump later became the 45th President and is now preparing for his second term against Kamala Harris.

title: Elon Musk’s post declaring Trump 'too old' for presidency resurfaces after endorsement
content: After Elon Musk endorsed Donald Trump for the upcoming US Presidential elections, old tweets criticizing Trump resurfaced. Previously, Musk had suggested Trump should retire and supported Ron DeSantis against Biden. Now, Trump has praised Musk, hinting at a potential role in his administration if re-elected, marking a shift in their dynamic.
summary: After Elon Musk endorsed Donald Trump for the upcoming US Presidential elections, old tweets criticizing Trump resurfaced. Previously, Musk had suggested Trump should retire and supported Ron DeSantis against Biden. Now, Trump has praised Musk, hinting at a potential role in his administration if re-elected, marking a shift in their dynamic.

title: Islamic State claims responsibility for Germany's knife attack that claimed 3 lives
content: The Islamic State claimed responsibility for a knife attack in Solingen, Germany, that killed three people during the city's 650th anniversary festival. The attacker targeted Christians in retaliation for the treatment of Muslims. Authorities conducted raids and arrested a teenager for withholding information. Investigations are ongoing, as the government pledges support to the affected city.
summary: The Islamic State claimed responsibility for a knife attack in Solingen, Germany, that killed three people during the city's 650th anniversary festival. The attacker targeted Christians in retaliation for the treatment of Muslims. Authorities conducted raids and arrested a teenager for withholding information. Investigations are ongoing, as the government pledges support to the affected city.

title: Kamala Harris can crack open an egg in one hand. Internet is impressed
content: Kamala Harris has a whole segment under 'Cooking with Kamala' in her YouTube channel and clips from those videos never fail to amaze social media users as Vice President Kamala Harris is readying for the presidential race. Recently, a video of her cracking open an egg in one hand went viral as social media users want to take up this method as a challenge.

title: 'Trapped, disconnected from reality': Pilot blames 'magic mushrooms' for mid-flight attempt to disable engines
content: Joseph Emerson, an off-duty pilot, claimed psychedelic mushrooms led him to attempt engine shutdown on an Alaska Airlines flight. Emerson, grappling with mental distress following a friend's death, tried to pull fire extinguisher handles mid-flight. Crew members subdued him, leading to an emergency landing in Portland.
summary: Joseph Emerson, an off-duty pilot, claimed psychedelic mushrooms led him to attempt engine shutdown on an Alaska Airlines flight. Emerson, grappling with mental distress following a friend's death, tried to pull fire extinguisher handles mid-flight. Crew members subdued him, leading to an emergency landing in Portland.

title: Teen paralyzed after botched dive in ‘pool squatting’ challenge sues owners: All about viral trend
content: An 18-year-old French man, paralyzed from a failed dive during the 'pool squatting' challenge in 2022, is suing the pool's owners for negligence. Claiming the property should have been secure, he seeks damages despite having entered illegally. This incident highlights the growing problem of unauthorized private pool usage in France.
summary: An 18-year-old French man, paralyzed from a failed dive during the 'pool squatting' challenge in 2022, is suing the pool's owners for negligence. Claiming the property should have been secure, he seeks damages despite having entered illegally. This incident highlights the growing problem of unauthorized private pool usage in France.

title: Cheryl Hines trolled for Kennedy Jr's Trump endorsement: 'A horrible f***ing person'
content: ​​RFK Jr's wife actor Cheryl Hines had to take the bullet for her husband's decision to endorse former president Donald Trump as the social media users trolled her for Kennedy Jr's decision calling her an 'enabler' and a 'horrible f***ing person'. Cheryl issued a statement Friday after her husband announced to suspend his campaign and support Donald Trump. Kennedy Jr acknowledged his wife's message and expressed his gratitude. He wrote that his wife was uncomfortable with the decision but accepted it.
summary: ​​RFK Jr's wife actor Cheryl Hines had to take the bullet for her husband's decision to endorse former president Donald Trump as the social media users trolled her for Kennedy Jr's decision calling her an 'enabler' and a 'horrible f***ing person'. Cheryl issued a statement Friday after her husband announced to suspend his campaign and support Donald Trump. Kennedy Jr acknowledged his wife's message and expressed his gratitude. He wrote that his wife was uncomfortable with the decision but accepted it.

title: Ohio shocker: Woman allegedly kills and eats cat in front of neighbors, arrested
content: A 27-year-old woman in Canton, Ohio, was arrested for allegedly killing and consuming a cat in front of her neighbors. The incident led to her being charged with injuring animals and disorderly conduct. Allexis Telia Ferrell's initial bond was set at $100,000 during her arraignment, highlighting the severity of the charges against her.
summary: A 27-year-old woman in Canton, Ohio, was arrested for allegedly killing and consuming a cat in front of her neighbors. The incident led to her being charged with injuring animals and disorderly conduct. Allexis Telia Ferrell's initial bond was set at $100,000 during her arraignment, highlighting the severity of the charges against her.

title: Kamala Harris' husband gets 'progressive sex symbol' tag: 'Move over, Ryan Gosling'
content: Second Gentleman Douglas Emhoff, the husband of Kamala Harris, has now earned a new moniker as Kamala Harris officially accepted the Democratic presidential nomination in Chicago -- with Doug being the spring in Kamal Harris' every step. Washington Post columnist Catherine Rampell called Doug Emhoff the progressive sex symbol who is secure about his masculinity to prioritize his wife's ambition.

title: Who is Joe Ando-Hirsh, TikTok trendsetter behind 'best dressed' Ella Emhoff at DNC
content: Ella Emhoff, stepdaughter of Vice President Kamala Harris, wore a unique pastel blue dress at the Democratic National Convention. Designed by TikTok star Joe Ando-Hirsh, the dress featured a flower embellishment crocheted by Emhoff herself. This collaboration highlighted Emhoff’s creative talents and emphasized the influence of emerging designers in political settings.

title: What will Elon Musk and RFK Jr get in administration if Trump wins, JD Vance reveals
content: A day before RFK Jr endorse Donald Trump, the former president's running mate and Ohio senator JD Vance revealed what role RFK Jr and Elon Musk would get in the Trump administration if he wins. "I would try not to put the cart too much before the horse. Elon is a genius and he will help us a great deal. But first we will have to win," JD Vance said at a podcast.
summary: A day before RFK Jr endorse Donald Trump, the former president's running mate and Ohio senator JD Vance revealed what role RFK Jr and Elon Musk would get in the Trump administration if he wins. "I would try not to put the cart too much before the horse. Elon is a genius and he will help us a great deal. But first we will have to win," JD Vance said at a podcast.

title: Andrew Tate’s luxury car fleet seized amid shocking new human trafficking allegations
content: Romanian authorities seized luxury vehicles from Andrew Tate amid human trafficking allegations involving Tate and his brother, Tristan. The DIICOT-led operation detained six individuals and confiscated assets, including cars and data devices. Both brothers are accused of serious crimes, including using the 'loverboy' method to coerce victims into producing pornographic content for financial gain.
summary: Romanian authorities seized luxury vehicles from Andrew Tate amid human trafficking allegations involving Tate and his brother, Tristan. Both brothers are accused of serious crimes, including using the 'loverboy' method to coerce victims into producing pornographic content for financial gain.
